content.description:
Climb the arete/pillar left of "

Your Orders

."  Start low with sloping sidepulls and pinches.  Slap your way to a fin-like top out.
content.location:
This is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island, on the far left side of the wall that houses the classic line "

The Captain

."

content.description:
This is a SDS to "

The Captain

" that starts just to the left on poor underclings.  Fire up into a two finger pocket with your left hand.  Slap out right.  Match and pull your way back onto the finishing moves of "

The Captain

."

It is a really fun variation to "

The Captain

."
content.location:
This is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island, just up and north of the 1st most obvious block which houses the "

Ship's Prow

."  It is on the same wall as "

The Captain

".

content.description:
Climb the shallow slab on the south face of "

[The Three Hour Tour

Block."  The line is just right of the corner problem "

Three Hour Tour

."  Nice slab but it seems to always be dirty.  Still, it's worth the climb.
content.location:
Located on the southern side of Gilligan's Island, the line is found on the south face of the "

Three Hour Tour

Block."

content.description:
If anyone has any information about the name or FA for this route, please feel free to update it or message me and I will do it.

Start on the same low and left crimp rail as for Beach Hut. Cross over to the right crimp rail then make a good move to a pinchy jug up and right. Left hand gaston to a good crimp and then make a balancy move to a good crimp. Finish up on a good slopey jug before topping out.
content.location:
This is on the Three Hour Tour Boulder on the same face as

Beach Hut

.

climbs.name: Tropicana
climbs.fa: Mark Vigil 2020?  If someone else climbed it, please claim it

content.description:
Start low and left of

Low Tide

on holds on the far left of the boulder, make some moves to the start of

Tropical Sea

, and finish through the crux of

Tropical Sea

. This add some more fun moves into

Tropical Sea

and felt like a more natural start to me.
content.protection: 2-3 pads can be nice to to traverse nature, although it can be protected with less.
content.location:
It is on the same boulder as

Low Tide

and

Tropical Sea

.

content.description:
SDS on an obvious flake, and continue up blunt arete using right hand sidepulls and left hand crimps. Heel hooks, balance, and a little compression lead to slopey but easy topout.

This is a great problem for beginners to work on technique. It makes for a comfortable, fun warm-up.

I am not sure if this has been climbed before, but I assume it has.

The starting flake is loose and will most likely break eventually.
content.location:
Climb the blunt arete to the right of

Tropical Sea

on the same boulder just to the left of

Lagoon

.

content.description:
On the northwest side of Gilligan's Island,

Mrs. Howell

and Thurston Howell are located kitty-corner to Skipper Boulder on the south side of the Homestead Trail. These two problems can be found as there is a small hole/cave/arch behind them.

Do a SDS off a recognizable pinch. Well-chalked, Thurston Howell climbs the arete of the boulder to a small pine tree.

Climb the blunt arete on the western most side of the south end of Gilligan's Island.

Start with you left hand in a good jug and you right on a small sloping crimp that has a crystal for your little finger. Toss up with your right to a bad sloper then get a heel hook up and right. Now you began the desperate journey to the top slapping and crimping small pebbles to higher but easier ground.

This is a great line!! It is a must do in the area!!
content.location:
It is located on the south end of Gilligan's Island.  When the trail from the parking lot splits, go left or west passing the "20 ft. Wave" block and the "

Ship's Prow

" boulder.  Just west, about 20 yards, past the "

Ship's Prow

" boulder you can see this blunt arete just barely covered by high tree limbs.  You can see it from the trail, and it is hard to miss.

content.description: Start from a big hole in the wall. Move up and left to a some what scary topout. This is a good low angle warm-up.
content.location:
Located on the south side of Gilligan's Island, it's a wall the is on the western side of the southern tip of the Island.

When you arrive at the Island and the trail splits for a loop, head west (left) as if going to the "

Three Hour Tour

" block.

Once you reach the

"Three Hour Tour

" boulder, go uphill directly behind the block.  You will see a just under vertical wall with a big hole right in the middle.

content.description:
Climb the middle of the "

Rescue

Wall" via a shallow. overhanging, left-facing corner to vertical face climbing to the top-out.
content.location:
Located on the East side of Gilligan's Island on the

Rescue

Wall, the line is just right of "

Rescue

" and is found in the middle of the wall.

content.description:
Stor Ofta is an easy climb with a great view.

Start with a low foot hold and trust the smear. Be creative with the finger holds. Walk off from the top.
content.location: Start in the upper parking lot, and hike on Bluebird to Gilligan's Island. Scramble to the upper most sector, the highest outcrop is rock to be climbed. Walk around to the west face of the outcrop. You should see the outcrop leaning against another feature, creating a tunnel. Climb the west face, and walk off the top.

content.description:
Start just below a crack system that breaks threw a 3-4 ft. roof at about 12 feet up.  Climb stright up the wall via face and some crack to the roof.  Keep your head together and move over the roof and finish to easyer climbing above.  Walk off.

The line is found just to the left of the mini drop off that signifies the start of "

Fearless Man

."

It's a nice (H.B.), but it does not get climbed a lot, so if you go for it be prepared to treat it like a little free solo!!
content.protection: Many pads and a few good spotters will really help on this one.  Although not that hard, a fall from the upper roof could cause great injury!!!
content.location:
It is located on the in the center on the west side of the main rock outcrop of Gilligan's Island.  To get there, you park in the 2nd parking lot on the west side of the park.  Then take the Bluebird Meadow Trail (staying west) and head out to Gilligan's Island.

Once you reach the Island and the trail makes its loop split, continue up towards the big, main outcrop trending westward.  You will pass the wall that has "

The Captain

" on your left.

Wind your way up to level ground making sure to stay on the left (west) side of the larger outcropping.

The line is located by walking (west) left until you are standing at the edge of a mini-cliff/dropoff.  The line starts down at the bottom of the dropoff. You will be able to see the obvious line that moves thought a crack in a high roof.

Side note:  This is a really photogenic line!!

content.description:
Start as far back on the sloping rail as you can.  Next you slap and heel hook your way around and under a large roof.  Make a few decisive moves to gain the outer lip and set up for the big finish move.  If your feet come loose, you may hit your spotter in the head, so watch out for that!!!

It is a great problem!!  This is also an area classic!!
content.protection: Pads and a spotter for the finishing moves.
content.location:
Located on the north west side of Gilligan's Island, this problem is on the north side of the Homestead Trail. As you start to come out of the woods and see the field out in front of you, keep looking to your left.

The line features a large roof with a traversing sloping rail that leads to a sick toss from the end.  It's visible from the trail.

content.description: Start with your both hands in a crack system down low.  Climb out and left through a long pointy nose like feature.  Pinch and slap over this odd feature to the top-out.
content.location: From the South side of Gilligan's Island, walk uphill trending a little east.  Just below the main formation this odd feature will come into view.

content.description:
Start on the crimping rail on the north end of this wall.  Traverse (staying low) from left to right finishing above "Six-Hour-Tour."

This is a great warm-up for "Six-Hour-Tour."
content.location:
Located on the east side of Gilligan's Island, it is visible from the Homestead trail loop on the left or looking west.

The wall's most striking feature is its cool, roof feature found on the wall's southern end.

content.description:
This problem begins as a SDS on the nose of an obvious prow.  Start with your right down low on a sharp but good crimp and you left on a small sidepull.  Pull for the better hold and jug above.

A standing start goes at about (V0).
content.location: This is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island on top of the granite slabs.  It's just west about 20 yards from a block that resembles a wave.

content.description:
Start (SDS) on a nice jug.  Pull up and move left to another good hold.  Reset your feet and reach up with your right to really cool pinch.  Then push up to a thin diagonal gash/crimp with your left.  Finish on good holds above.  Walk off to the right and then down climb a short gully back to your pads.

This line may not be for every one, but I just love the moves.  And the pinch in the middle of this slightly over hanging wall is cool.  It's short but sweet.
content.location:
It is located on the in the center on the west side of the main rock outcrop of Gilligan's Island.  To get there, you park in the 2nd parking lot on the west side of the park.  Then take the Bluebird Meadow Trail (staying west), and head out to Gilligan's Island.

Once you reach the Island and the trail makes its loop split, you can either continue up towards the big main outcrop while trending westward.  In effect, you are then going over the Island to get to the slopes of the north side.

Or you can take the trail split (left) west and wrap around the out skirts of the Island.  Once on the north side turn back south and start heading uphill.  Make sure that the main outcrop is now on you (left) eastern side.  Stay close to the outcrop, and you will walk right up to the steep, medium-sized wall.

content.description:
Start in the same two handed jug as for "

The Captain

."  Next move up and right onto band slopers.  Continue up into a shallow scoop just to the left of a small ledge that is about head height.  This ledge is off for the full value.
content.location:
Located on the south side of Gilligan's Island, this line is found on the same wall as "

The Captain

,"  which is north and west of the block that looks like a wave.  This area is more of a wall than a free standing boulder.

content.description:
Climb the arete to the right of "

Smoke Signals

."
content.location:
This is located at the center of Gilligan's Island next the problem "

Smoke Signals

."  Climb the overhanging arete just right of "

Smoke Signals

."

content.description:
Start with a SDS low under the left (south end) of the east side out-crop.  Move through very hard long reaches on finger breaking crimps to am more rounded and forgiving top-out.

This is a great problem!!  Do Try!
content.location: It is located on the east side of Gilligan's Island.  This outcrop is visible from the Homestead Trail.  It's most noticeable feature is a low, cool-looking roof on its southern end of the wall.

content.description: Start down low (SDS) on two good flat crimps.  Use the a bad right handed sloper/crimp to gain a jug and then the top.  It's a one move wonder.  But worth a try if your in the area.
content.location:
Located in the woods on the north west end of Gilligan's Island, it's found on the north side of the Homestead trail before you get to the "

Skipper

" block.  It's about 50 feet west of "

Skipper

" on a short, blank looking bulge.  I'm not sure if it's visible from the trail.  I think that it is in the fall.

content.description:
"Poop Deck" is a short toprope (or potentially highball) route on Gilligan's Island, which follows an overhanging arete.

Beta:

A few easy moves quickly lead to a reachy, tricky, roof problem just a couple meters off the ground. Mind your rope carefully through this section. After pulling through the roof, a lieback leads to technical smears and crimpers up the bulging prow. The difficulty eases considerably upon reaching the top of the bulge.

The grade is approximate, and a consensus rating has yet to be established. Feel free to offer your input.
content.protection:
Build a toprope anchor using clean trad-gear placements (a few nuts, hexes, and long slings) near the summit of Gilligan's Island. The top is easily accessible via a short scramble up the south side, or a low 5th-class solo up the crack to the left of

Keelhauling

. Bring extra cord and extend the anchor to reduce rope drag. Walk off the south side.
content.location:
Just a few meters right of

Fearless Man

lies a short, vertical rock face by the largest pine tree in the vicinity. Poop Deck and

Keelhauling

(see photo) share a gear anchor at the top.

climbs.name: No One's Gonna Buy You a Big Wheel

content.description: This is a fun, albeit short, inverted, offwidth problem. Get in it, work your feet as high as you can, and chicken wing your way through the pivot.
content.location:
It ascends the obvious offwidth crack immediately left of

Rescue

. Start inverted with your hands on the same start hold as

Rescue

. Work up through the pivot, then go up some more.

content.description:
On the northwest side of Gilligan's Island, Mrs. Howell and

Thurston Howell

are located kitty-corner to Skipper Boulder on the south side of the Homestead Trail. These two problems can be found as there is a small hole/cave/arch behind them.

Left of

Thurston Howell

, Mrs. Howell does a SDS off a extremely well-chalked, large rail. Climb up and left finishing with a horizontal hand crack to the top of the boulder. Downclimb the backside.

An extra pad may be advised due to the sloping rock behind the problem.

climbs.name: Matt Damon Is Inside Of Marry Ann
climbs.fa: ?  I'm sure many have done it prior

content.description:
Start on a gritty incut and make a big move onto a rail.  Traverse out right towards '

Marry Ann

' and top out via a jug system.
content.location:
This is inside "

Marry Ann's

" cave.

content.description: Climb up the arching arete of this cave-like feature found on the eastern most side of south Gilligan Island.
content.location: This is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island.  When you reach the Island head up the slabs and (right) or east for about 20 or so yards.  You will then see this line come into view.

content.description:
Start in the big hole, the same as for "

Tropical Sea

."

Once you pass the hole, move right and face the insecure finish on really bad holds!!

This one is all about foot work.  This is a fun line that is worth a visit.
content.location:
This is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island.  It's a wall the is on the western side of the southern tip of the Island.

When you arrive at the Island and the trail splits for a loop head west (left) as if going to the "

Three Hour Tour

" block. Once you reach the "

Three Hour Tour

" boulder, go uphill directly behind the block.  You will see a just under vertical wall with a big hole right in the middle.

content.description:
A SDS under a small overhang on the north west side of the "

Three Hour Tour

" block.

From a sitting position, grab two crimps on a small crimp ledge.  Drop knee, and toss out left to the lip of the roof.  Claw your way past the slopers to gain the top out.  It is short but fun.
content.location:
It is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island.  This line can be found by approaching the problem "

Three Hour Tour

."  Once this westward block is located, walk around to the backside (the northwest corner) and you will see the small but devastating roof problem.

content.description:
This is simply the standing start to "

Skipper

."  You start on crimps under the roof and just shot for the top.  It's cool, but the full "

Skipper

" is where it's at.
content.location:
This is located on the north west side of Gilligan's Island.  This problem is on the north side of the Homestead trail. As you start to come out of the woods and see the field out in front of you, keep looking to your left.

The line features a large roof that leads to a sick toss from the end.  It's visible from the trail.

content.description:
"Keelhauling" is a short toprope (or potentially highball) route on Gilligan's Island, which ascends the center of a featured face just right of "

Fearless Man

."

Start just to the right of a deep crack and ascend clean rock to a large bulge. Work right around the bulge and follow a short flake/crack to the top.
content.protection:
Just a few meters right of

Fearless Man

lies a short, vertical rock face by the largest pine tree in the vicinity.

Poop Deck

and Keelhauling (see photo) share a gear anchor at the top.
content.location:
Build a toprope anchor using clean trad-gear placements (a few nuts, hexes, and long slings) near the summit of Gilligan's Island. The top is easily accessible via a short scramble up the south side or a low 5th-class solo up the crack to the left of

Keelhauling

. Bring extra cord and extend the anchor to reduce rope drag. Walk off the south side.

content.description: This line starts inside an "A"-framed, mini cave.  You start with your whole body inside the cave facing a westerly position on decent crimps.  Next you pull up and left to get onto the corner.  You then climb up and out of the cave to the finish and then you walk off.
content.location:
It is located on the in the center on the west side of the main rock out-crop of Gilligan's Island.  To get there, you park in the 2nd parking lot on the west side of the park.  Then take the Bluebird Meadow Trail (staying west) and head out to Gilligan's Island.

Once you reach the Island and the trail makes its loop split, continue up towards the big main out-crop trending westward.  You will pass the wall that has "

The Captain

" on your left.

Wind your way up to level ground making sure to stay on the left (west) side of the larger out-cropping.

The cave line will come into your line of sight.  The right side of the cave wall is actually leaning up against the large outcrop.  That's it.

content.description: Start on opposing sidepulls, stand up into the undercling seam, get a left hand crimper and a right hand pebble, high left foot and stand up into the jug.
content.location: This is on the southeast side of Gilligan's Island.

content.description:
Start with a (SDS) under a bulging wall right next to a mini cliff drop off.  Take caution on the opening moves!!

Move out from a crack system while trending right to a steep bulging face with a few small key crimps.  While working to gain solid balanced via technical foot placements, continue crimping and slapping to the top of the block.  Then walk off.

Just for the record I love this problem!!  I think if you are in the area you should give it a go!!!
content.protection: Pads and spotters.  At the start of the problem there is potential to fall about 10-15 feet of a mini cliff.  The fall could be a bad one, so be careful.
content.location:
Located on the in the center on the west side of the main rock out-crop of Gilligan's Island.  To get there you park in the 2nd parking lot on the west side of the park.  Then take the Bluebird Meadow Trail (staying west) and head out to Gilligan's Island.

Once you reach the Island and the trail makes its loop split continue up towards the big main out-crop trending westward.  You will pass the wall that has "

The Captain"

on your left.

Wind your way up to level ground making sure to stay on the left (west) side of the larger out-cropping.

The line is about 20-30 feet left (west) of the cave called "

Island Hut

." The line will come into your line of sight if you are looking out left.  Walk around to your left and you will see a mini cliff/drop off.  The line starts sitting down just right of the drop off.  Enjoy!!

content.description:
Climb the rightmost, overhanging arete and face on the

Rescue

Wall.
content.location:
This is located on the east side of Gilligan's Island on the

Rescue

Wall.  Climb the rightmost overhang and face to the top-out.

content.description:
Begin in the underclings for

Your Orders

.  Move left to the pocket, continue trending left through underclings, and then over the prow.  Powerful and somewhat of an eliminate as the massive pillar to the left of the bulge is off for feet.
content.protection: Quite a few pads as it is powerful and the feet are quick to pick off.

content.description:
Climb the west end buldge from a SDS.  This climb is on the same boulder as "

Coconut

" and the"

Ship's Prow

."
content.location: This is located on the southern most side of Gilligan's Island, just west of a block that looks like a wave.

content.description:
Climb the right side of "The

20ft. Wave

" block via a small crack system to the top-out.
content.location: This is located on the South side of Gilligan's Island on the 20 foot Wave Block.

content.description:
Start on the southern most face (left of the "

Ship's Prow

").  Reach up with both hands to a sloping, horizontal seam, smear your feet on the wall an toss to better hold gaining the top.
content.location: This is located on Gilligan's Island, on the south side of the Island just west of a block that looks like a wave.  The black rock on the southern side of this block is your line.

content.description:
Start with a (SDS) on the left most edge of the wall.  Work your way up while staying left to good but spooky hand and foot holds.  Mantel to the top for the finish.

It's an odd feeling line to me.  I don't really bother with it all that much.
content.location:
This is located on the in the center on the west side of the main rock outcrop of Gilligan's Island.  To get there, you park in the 2nd parking lot on the west side of the park.  Then take the Bluebird Meadow Trail (staying west) and head out to Gilligan's Island.

Once you reach the Island and the trail makes its loop split, you can either continue up towards the big main outcrop while trending westward.  In effect, you are then going over the Island to get to the slopes of the north side.

Or you can take the trail split (left) west and wrap around the out skirts of the Island.  Once on the north side turn back south and start heading up hill.  Make sure that the main outcrop is now on you (left) eastern side.  Stay close to the outcrop and you will walk right up to the steep, medium-sized wall.  This line is climbs the leftmost side of the wall.

content.description:
Start sitting down slightly under the east side of the boulder with the "

Ship's Prow

" on its southern tip. Pinch/sidepull with your left and crimps for the right.  Work your way up the over hanging arete/corner to the top out.  Watch your feet....  There is a low-angled slab that follows your back side all the way up this one.
content.location: It is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island.  The boulder housing the line is just west of a block that looks like a wave.

content.description:
Start with both hands in a big in cut jug.  Move up and left for a small crimp.  Gain a toe or heel hook in the starting hold and push high above your head to another crimp.  Work up into a shallow corner/scoop via sloping crimps.  Once you are over the overhang exit right and walk off.

Classic!!!  A must do on the south side of the Island!!
content.location:
This is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island.  This line is on the wall up and north of the 1st obvious boulder that houses the "

Ship's Prow

."  This line can also be identified by a shade tree that shares its perch.

content.description:
Move right along the wall until you are below final reach, then climb up with a right or left hold. This is a simple warm-up/beginner route on Castaway Wall.

Dyno alternative - from matched on the start hold, dyno or static (if wingspan will allow) to the top, and mantel over.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter are recommended.
content.location:
Park in the second parking lot on the west end of the park, by the barn. Walk through Bluebird Meadow on Bluebird Meadow Trail towards the butte (Gilligan's Island) itself. Come around Gilligan's Island, and just about in the middle, go off trail toward the butte itself. Stick along the butte, slightly off trail until you find a small dirt path leading up. This is a fairly obvious and easy route up that requires no scramble. Almost tucked inward toward the butte is a fairly steep, medium-sized wall with the routes

Castaway

,

Seven On The Beach

, and now Beginner's Luck.

content.description:
Climb the crack and face system on the east side of the "

Three Hour Tour

" boulder.
content.location:
This is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island.  When the trail from the parking lot splits out in front of the Island, head (left) west.  You will see this tall, east-facing weakness from the trail.  It's located on the same boulder as "

Three Hour Tour

."

content.description: Climb the south face of "The 20ft Wall."  Using crimps and the left arete make your way to the top.
content.location:
Located on the South side of Gilligan's Island on the south facing wall of "The

20ft. Wave

Block."

content.description:
Climb the crack system to the left of "

Fearless Man

."  Be careful when topping out not to fall into the looming drop off just under your feet!!!!
content.location:
It is located on the (center) most part if Gilligan's Island, left of "

Fearless Man

."

content.description:
Starting on the low horns right of

Marry Ann

, move over and right. Use a good amount of heel hooks before setting up on a good jug. Bump across a couple of crimps before setting a high heel hook. Fire up for the rail and climb up onto the slabs after moving about 10 feet to the right from the start. It's hard to keep your back from hitting the rock that sits right at the base of the climb.
content.protection: Just a spotter to keep you from rolling down the hill.
content.location:
When looking at the

Marry Ann

cave, move over the farthest right point of the rock to find a good-sized handrail. Start here, and traverse out and right around the horn of the rock.

content.description:
A great line!!  It is oOne of the most noticeable blocks when you first arrive on the south end of Gilligan's Island.

Climb up and over the center of the west facing wave-like face.  It has a scary top-out!!  But it is so fun.
content.location: This is located on the south side of Gilligan's Island.  The wave like block can be seen just west of where the trail splits into a big loop.
